intro: Serruria phylicoides, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, often with a serrated edge, giving it a distinctive appearance. Serruria phylicoides is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
